data.title: Escape paths in bootstrap and clean scripts
data.body: I just tried to check out and build the repository, and apparently I'm the only weirdo who has tried to do this in a folder with spaces or other special characters in its name in a year and a half?

data.title: Remove non-essential update guard flags from TextEditorPresenter
data.body:
The only extremely expensive operation we need to avoid unless it's needed is decoration computation. The rest of these flags don't really warrant the added complexity for the tiny amount of computation they save. Eventually, we'll make the decoration computation so fast so that we can always execute the entire code path whenever we update the editor. This will be easier to reason about both in terms of adding functionality and thinking about performance in a variety of circumstances. Removing the bulk of the flags gets us part of the way there.

/cc @as-cii

data.title: Use internal scroll assignment methods when committing logical positions
data.body:
This prevents an additional pending scroll top/left assignment and cuts directly to adjusting the positions, saving us an update cycle. It prevents the only major case of emitting an update event during state computation.

@as-cii Am I missing anything here?

data.title: Atom freezes with split panes on OS X
data.body:
To reproduce:

``` sh
$ mkdir -p atom_test/{lib,test}
$ cd atom_test
$ touch lib/transport.js test/transport.js
```

Add some content to the two files. Open one of the files and then split the pane vertically. After splitting the panes, atom freezes and requests to close. 

It only seems to happen if the filename is the same, but they are in different directories. (`test/transport.js` and `lib/transport.js`)

Atom version: v1.3.1
Darwin Mac-Pro.local 15.0.0 Darwin Kernel Version 15.0.0: Sat Sep 19 15:53:46 PDT 2015; root:xnu-3247.10.11~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

What is really weird is that it just started doing it out of the blue. I have tried removing ~/.atom/storage and it still does not work.

data.title: Scrollbars can't be styled without making them visible the whole time
data.body:
It sounds funny, I know. But it looks like it's currently not possible to style the editor's scrollbars without making them visible the whole time. Just try it: Add some stylings to your theme's stylesheet and suddenly the scrollbars will be visible the whole time.

I've tried it, too. If you want to see an example, just clone [material-ui](https://github.com/leo/material-ui/blob/master/styles/atom.less) and comment out the last few lines. Usually, this should just change the look of the scrollbars. But what it really does is making the scrollbars visible the whole time (independed from your OS' settings).

I also haven't yet seen a theme that managed to style them without making them visible the whole time. Would be awesome if this could be fixed! :see_no_evil:

data.title: When copy/paste same named file, new folder is created above working dir, dangerous
data.body:
Hi, I have a working directory, (project's directory openned with atom)

/home/frdm/gDrive/3.1__Tretak ZS/ZSUR/zsur-sp

And when I try copy+paste a file from sidebar, in my case file

```
/home/frdm/gDrive/3.1__Tretak ZS/ZSUR/zsur-sp/app/source/data.txt
```

to (note that it will not fail when no "data.txt" file is inside)

```
/home/frdm/gDrive/3.1__Tretak ZS/ZSUR/zsur-sp/tomas/Skripty/
```

What should happen?
Nothing or maybe warning or overwrite confirmation dialog. 

What happens instead.
A new directory tree is created outside working directory (note that data has no postfix ".txt")

```
/home/frdm/gDrive/30.1__Tretak ZS/ZSUR/zsur-sp/tomas/Skripty/data
```

From my point of view it is completely dangerous behavior.

---

Arch linux with a kernel 4.3.1 and I am using systemd 228

Atom version 1.3.1

data.title: Release Notes not showing anything past 1.1.0
data.body:
It looks like the release call is getting back the right JSON, but the page won't show anything past 1.1.0 and the button restart and install is active.

This has happened for a while. running Atom 1.3.1

data.title: atom.workspace.observeTextEditors gets fired multiple times and also for non-existent panes.
data.body:
using some code that fires on a textEditor save event e.g.

``` coffee
    @disposable.add  atom.workspace.observeTextEditors (textEditor) =>
      @disposable.add textEditor.onDidSave (event) =>
          textEditor.setCursorBufferPosition [0,0]
```
1. On saving a a file e.g. test,js the above code fires once - correct
2. Now split screen to have two edit panes/tabs for test.js and save file - above code fires twice - I would expect only one firing of this code ( corresponds with https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8853)
3. Now remove one of the tabs for test.js and save the test.js - above code still fires twice! but one of the calls to textEditor.setCursorBufferPosition gets a stack trace and message `This TextEditor has been destroyed` obviously because the pane no longer exists.

This all seems a bit flaky to me! Surely an onDidSave event should only fire once for all instances of the same file and never when a tab has been removed!!!!

data.title: Steps for manual update behind HTTPS proxy?
data.body:
I am using Atom in a corporate environment with a **self-signed proxy certificate** which is probably the reason why I can not update Atom.

If I download the latest delta package(s) manually from GitHub where should I place the file(s) and how to trigger the update (via command line)?

It would be nice to have these manual-update steps documented in the FAQ.

data.title: Cache v8 code by source file's SHA1
data.body:
Fixes #10015 
Fixes #10003

We've discovered an issue in the way V8 matches source files against a cache blob that causes the cache not to be discarded if the source files is sufficiently similar to the compile cache.

As a result, instead of relying on V8 to invalidate the cache, we compute a hash of the file's contents and use that as an invalidation key for `FileSystemBlobStore` and `NativeCompileCache`.

/cc: @nathansobo @maxbrunsfeld @atom/feedback

data.title: Release note doesn't update

Hey,

I'm currently using **Atom v1.3.1** on **Windows 10**.
Yet, the release note is stuck on v1.1.0 - I have to check on [atom.io](https://atom.io/releases) to see what are the updates.

Is it normal the green button "Restart and update" remains here even if I'm on the latest version?

data.title: Fix visible screen row line count checks.
data.body: Visible screen row calculations should use getScreenLineCount so that correct values are found when text is wrapped or folded.

data.title: Atom crashes when save while autocomplete box is open
data.body:
I hope these steps are really what is reproducing the problem, and that this isn't specific to the 1300+ line file that I have open.

Using TypeScript (so this may be related to TypeStrong/atom-typescript) when I type in a class name that causes the autocomplete box to pop up, if I press Ctrl+S to save before that box goes away, Atom freezes and ultimately crashes.  It's really annoying because I do this all the time out of habit.

If there's any additional info I can provide, please let me know how to obtain it.

data.title: Updating Atom on Windows creates a new shortcut on the desktop
data.body: Seems that every time Atom updates, it creates a new shortcut on the desktop for Atom.

data.title: Uncaught Error: ELOOP: too many symbolic links encountered, open '/Users/slauae/.atom/keymap.cson'
data.body:
I am attempting to store my keymap.cson in another folder (git repo) so I can update and share it on multiple computers. I cannot use the sync package that exists because of network limitations at my office.

To get this error:
1. move keymap.cson to another folder
2. create symlink: ln -s /myother/folder/keymap.cson ~/.atom/keymap.cson
3. attempt to access the keymap file from Atom Settings

Note, my keybindings work like expected, just can't access them from settings.

**Atom Version**: 1.3.1
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: ELOOP: too many symbolic links encountered, open '/Users/slauae/.atom/keymap.cson'

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:486

Error: ELOOP: too many symbolic links encountered, open '/Users/slauae/.atom/keymap.cson'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:549:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:137:20)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.openTextFile (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:528:27)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.openURIInPane (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:461:23)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.open (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:393:19)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/atom-environment.js:337:38
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.openURIInPane (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:454:22)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.open (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:393:19)
    at AtomEnvironment.module.exports.AtomEnvironment.openLocations (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/atom-environment.js:1035:19)
    at EventEmitter.outerCallback (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/application-delegate.js:201:18)
    at emitTwo (events.js:92:20)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:172:7)
```
### Commands

```
     -0:03.7.0 settings-view:open (div.pane-item.native-key-bindings.about)
     -0:00.7.0 application:open-your-keymap (atom-workspace.workspace.scrollbars-visible-when-scrolling.theme-atom-dark-syntax.theme-atom-dark-ui)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "themes": [
      "atom-dark-ui",
      "atom-dark-syntax"
    ],
    "disabledPackages": [
      "autocomplete-clang",
      "emacs-mode",
      "transient-emacs",
      "tabs",
      "autocomplete-snippets",
      "tree-view",
      "autocomplete-plus"
    ],
    "destroyEmptyPanes": false,
    "audioBeep": false
  },
  "editor": {
    "invisibles": {},
    "fontSize": 12,
    "showIndentGuide": true,
    "showInvisibles": true,
    "preferredLineLength": 120,
    "softWrap": true
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
autocomplete-moose, v0.19.0
language-moose, v0.16.0
pane-info, v1.0.0

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Big scrolling performances drop when scrolling past end
data.body:
This is what I measure when scrolling in the middle of a file: 
![reference-scroll](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/247140/11724413/35dcba42-9f74-11e5-88e7-7f9d73b6b029.png)

This is what I measure when scrolling at the end of the file with scroll past end enabled:
![scroll-past-end](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/247140/11724414/37e86034-9f74-11e5-8670-b70be0f2f68d.png)

FWIW I made the same measurement in safe mode and got the same result so it's not caused by a package.

cc/ @nathansobo @as-cii

data.title: apm install partial code trace
data.body:
Atom: v1.4.0-beta0
OS: Windows 10 x64

I'm seeing the following when installing packages:

```
C:\path> apm install linter
Installing <package> to C:\Users\Landon Abney\.atom\packages
C:\Users\Landon Abney\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.4.0-beta0\resources\app.asar\src\compile-cache.js:163
let prepareStackTrace = prepareStackTraceWithSourceMapping
^^^
done
```

Unfortunately that is all the output, it looks like it is pointing to [this line](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/v1.4.0-beta0/src/compile-cache.js#L163), but beyond that I'm not sure what is going on as it seems to install the package properly.

I did not see this in v1.3.0-beta6, and I'm pretty sure beta7 was fine as well.

data.title: There is no ES6 in compile-cache.js
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/atom/apm/issues/476

data.title: Cannot open developer tools after upgrading to beta 1.4.0
data.body:
After upgrading to the latest beta version I am not longer able to open the develper tools. It just does nothing. I am seeing also random crashes but not sure if it's related.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Open Atom in any mode, e.g.: `atom --foreground --safe`
2. Try to toggle the developer tools. Same behavior from `View -> Developer -> Toggle Developer Tools` or using the shortcut `Ctrl+Shift+I`

Same behavior if starting Atom in dev mode.

**Errors logged**
- When trying to toggle the developer tools.

```
[24901:1210/161108:INFO:CONSOLE(22)] "Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected identifier", source: /usr/local/share/atom/resources/atom.asar/common/api/lib/callbacks-registry.js (22)
[24901:1210/161108:INFO:CONSOLE(52)] "Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected identifier", source: /usr/local/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/notifications/lib/main.js (52)
```

```
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/usr/local/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:204:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)

```

**Atom version:** 1.4.0-beta0-ed7283f
**OS and version:** Fedora 22 with KDE running in VirtualBox 5.

**Installed packages:**

```
atom-material-ui
autocomplete-clang
autocomplete-emojis
autocomplete-python
autocomplete-xml
blame
docblockr
file-icons
fold-comments
git-control
git-diff-details
git-history
git-log
git-plus
git-projects
hyperclick
idiomatic-dark-syntax
linter
linter-alex
linter-clang
linter-gcc
linter-pep8
linter-xmllint
merge-conflicts
minimap
minimap-autohide
minimap-bookmarks
minimap-find-and-replace
minimap-git-diff
minimap-highlight-selected
minimap-linter
minimap-selection
tag
term3
tool-bar
tool-bar-almighty
travis-ci-status
xkcd-comics
```

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: Yes, after upgrading to beta 1.4.0.
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes, it happens always.
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes

data.title: Non-fatal Segmentation fault of fedora with 1.3.0
data.body:
Atom runs just fine, but I do get this outputted to the console:

```
/usr/bin/atom: line 113:  8100 Segmentation fault      (core dumped) nohup "$ATOM_PATH" --executed-from="$(pwd)" --pid=$$ "$@" > "$ATOM_HOME/nohup.out" 2>&1
App load time: 207ms
Failed to get crash dump id.
Report Id: 
```
